title: Euler & 18th Century Mathematics: The Age of Calculation
description: Leonhard Euler's monumental contributions to mathematics and mechanics, alongside Leibniz's philosophy and Pascal's probability theory - the mathematical foundations of the Enlightenment.

books.title: Einleitung in die Analysis des Unendlichen
books.author: Leonhard Euler

books.title: Oeuvres de Blaise Pascal Vol. I
books.author: Blaise Pascal

keyContributions: Euler Mechanica (1736): First systematic treatise on analytical mechanics
Euler Analysis (1748): Introduction to infinitesimal calculus, foundational
Euler Calculus of Variations (1744): Optimization and variational principles
Leibniz: Co-inventor of calculus (independently of Newton), monadology
Pascal: Probability theory, hydraulics, calculating machines
Leeuwenhoek: First observations of bacteria and protozoa
researchValue: Euler was the most prolific mathematician in history. His works laid foundations for modern mathematics and physics. Leibniz's calculus and philosophy shaped the Enlightenment. Pascal pioneered probability theory.
